text: [Laughter]
hi everyone dear god please let me live
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
young thug album punk this is a brand
new lp from one of modern hip-hop's
boldest innovators a man whose elastic
ever evolving vocal style helped define
the latter half of the 2010s and blurred
the lines between hip-hop and everything
else and he continues to push boundaries
on punk as there's numerous tracks here
that show young thug delivering really
introspective lyrics and mellow vocal
performances over sparkling beds of
guitar which was pretty much the musical
tone he hit on his recent tiny desk
concert it's also important to note
young thug has flirted with a more
guitar-based sound before most
consistently on his project beautiful
thugger girls but i've always felt like
he never explored the full potential of
a rapper gone singer-songwriter on that
project and given his vocal range if
anyone in hip-hop can make that
transition i think it's him and he
certainly does do that on punk at least
for the first leg the opening track dies
slow which was one of the more notable
moments in that tiny desk concert that i
mentioned earlier there are some
atmospheric electric guitars on this one
that set a stage for some really
personal and sometimes tragic bars from
thugger his delivery on this one runs
almost like spoken word maybe this track
is more understated and dramatic than
some long time fans were expecting but
honestly i thought it was emotionally
compelling and just shows thugger's
range stupid slash asking tells a story
of lying cheating overspending but the
twist here is thugger is telling the
story from the standpoint of the woman
dealing with him plus the insane beat
transition into the asking section of
the song was not only a stroke of genius
but it feels genuinely and and
narratively like a part of the song not
just some like non-sequitur beat switch
or anything like that it just feels like
an extension of everything emotionally
that's been happening so far recognize
real was another moment on the lp that
finds power in
somber loki acoustic guitars and tragic
bars even hearing gunna on this track
with no auto tune on his voice and
coming across pretty emotive and i guess
uh sincere lyrically and vocally was a
refreshing change of pace then
contagious comes through with a strong
hook strong message wishing that uh
keeping it real was contagious instead
of being met with fakeness it's not a
guitar cut but the dreamy beats and keys
certainly met the tone of most of the
song so far so i love all these tracks
so far not just because i think they are
quality but i also think they're
kind of interesting and unlikely start
to a young thug album however my issue
is is that past this point
there's no real follow through the focus
on this sound and mood is abandoned and
not only that but the quality of the
songwriting drops off severely the track
featuring juice world is embarrassingly
derivative it just sees thugger working
a very bad cardi impression over a
pierre bournebee then juice on the back
end isn't even mixed into the beat all
that well and even though over the past
few years we've got a lot of impressive
posthumous tracks and
verses from juice's camp i don't think
this is one of them then we have living
it up with post malone and asap rocky
which
to young thugs defense is an acoustic
track but it's not of the vibe and
quality of the tracks that are you know
again more guitar leaning so far this
feels like an ed sheeran song but with
like
young thug uh doing it instead or i
don't know like like a bad rendition or
a bad bizarro version of justin bieber's
love yourself yeah the whole vibe of
this track just feels like uh frat boys
chugging white claws i'm not into it
yeah yeah yeah between its acoustic
guitar licks and beat seems almost like
a southern pop rap piece from the 2000s
or maybe a bit of an outcast ripoff
which overall would be fine if not for
the fact that the b is bland as hell the
hook is uninspired and it just feels
like thugger is not
trying to write on this one at all
there's also scoliosis featuring little
double o and i was not ready for the
quality of this project to drop off
as hard as it does on this track
what the hell is this is this like a bad
mix tape extra or something it's not
even mixed like it's audibly worse and
messier than every other song here how
it made the cut onto this 20-track album
we didn't even need this many songs to
begin with but like we somehow got this
on here from this point it's like young
thug's vocal lines and beats get blander
and more unimaginative faces dropping
jewels fifth day dead which is about as
middle of the road as i think young thug
tracks can get in 2021 but honestly i
wish the rest of the record just like
stayed boring because what we are left
with is
uh there's icy hot with dojicat which
gorsh that's how goofy this track is
what are these squeaky vocal leads
layered on top of each other the auto
tune is awful my god yeah between the
vocal work and the hook and the beat
just being very very skeletal this is
all kinds of annoying just an awful idea
for a song and honestly like a waste of
a doja cat feature because i usually
like her features a lot she usually does
bring a bit of pep or energy or spark to
attract but
yeah this was just not one of those
cases again mostly because like i feel
like there was no saving this song off
the back but there are other big
features on this thing that falter in a
major way too j cole launching into a
partial second verse that is totally
unnecessary has no sense of direction
and just like ends out of nowhere i
suppose this part could be seen as a
bridge but it just feels so out of place
even drake is sounding awkward as hell
with a subpar vocal performance and this
flow where he's like laying on the vowel
sound at the end of every other bar so
the track he's on just ends out of
nowhere too yeah this record in my
opinion was just really not it it was a
total mess uh no idea what it wanted to
do or wanted to accomplish i think it
started off really well
and if it somehow continued with
those ideas and kept dishing out quality
songs while doing that punk could have
been great punk could have been one of
the best records in young thug's
discography i think you know given the
first leg that's kind of what it was
setting itself up for but then i guess
at a certain point this record just gets
tired of uh doing that and gives up
entirely on uh
uh that direction and just sounding good
in general uh i'm feeling a decent three
on this one
tran position have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well over here next to my head
is another another video that you could
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
young thug
forever
